definitions.definition: the act of causing great physical or mental pain in order to persuade someone to do something or to give information, or to be cruel to a person or animal:
examples: Half of the prisoners died after torture and starvation.
The rush-hour traffic was sheer torture as usual.

definitions.definition: to cause great physical or mental pain to someone intentionally:
examples: It is claimed that the officers tortured a man to death in a city police station.
He tortured himself for years with the thought that he could have stopped the boy from running into the road.
